Can you please confirm if your group will allow a payment extension and the latest date, we can accept the payment?

body:

Learn why this is important
Download your 1099 from Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC 
 
Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC sent your 1099 with QuickBooks
 
Set up your free Intuit account to view it.
 
 
View your 1099
 
 
 
You're one step closer to filing your taxes. Create a free Intuit account to 
view
, 
download
, or 
print
 your 1099. If you use TurboTax, you can also 
send
 your tax info directly to the app.
This makes business easier down the road, too. When you pick up other clients who use QuickBooks, they can also send your 1099s to this account.
 
View your 1099
 
You received this email because your client e-delivered your 1099. To keep your digital tax info safe it never leaves our Intuit database. To view your 1099 online, login with existing TurboTax, Mint, or QuickBooks credentials or create a free intuit account. Please check with your client if you have any questions. security.intuit.com
.

click here

subject: Important: Tax Reconciliation Email Update
body:
You don't often get email from noreply@clients.trinet.com. 
Learn why this is important
 
Hello Jennifer,
On Friday, January 5, 2024, you may have received emails from us stating your company would receive either a credit or a debit for the second, third and/or fourth quarters of 2023 as part of year-end payroll tax reconciliation efforts. 
Please disregard the emails you received regarding quarters two and/or three. These were sent due to a system issue, and your account will not be debited or credited for those quarters. 
If you received an email about a credit or debit as part of year-end payroll tax reconciliation for the fourth quarter of 2023, the email is valid and contains the correct information you need for your company’s fourth quarter 2023 payroll taxes. To easily find the email, search for the subject line “Important: Your 4th Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete.” If you did not receive that specific email, payroll tax reconciliation was not required for your company for the fourth quarter of 2023.
We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and have put additional safeguards in place to help ensure this does not happen again. If you have any questions, please contact our 
support team
.
Regards, 
TriNet
© 2024 TriNet Group, Inc. All rights reserved. This communication is for informational purposes only, is not legal, tax or accounting advice, and is not an offer to sell, buy or procure insurance. TriNet is the single-employer sponsor of all its benefit plans, which does not include voluntary benefits that are not ERISA-covered group health insurance plans and enrollment is voluntary. Official plan documents always control and TriNet reserves the right to amend the benefit plans or change the offerings and deadlines.
Please note that you cannot opt-out of an email that is required to provide you information about your relationship with TriNet. To update the types of communications you receive from TriNet, including opting out of all non-operational email communications, 
click here
 to visit the TriNet Communication Preference Center. Or you can mail your unsubscribe request to: TriNet, One Park Place, Suite 600 Dublin, CA 94568.
C-24JAN-19

subject: [Important] Your 1st Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Zenefits Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
credited to 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by April 07, 2023 for $0.04 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
All In One report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
Zenefits 
Questions or concerns? Visit 
help.zenefits.com
. 
© Zenefits

subject: Important TriNet Zenefits changes you need to know about
body:
TriNet Zenefits will be making some changes.
  
TriNet Zenefits will be making some changes.
Here’s everything you need to know.
Over the past few years, we’ve worked hard to unify our TriNet Zenefits products and services to offer the power of scale for your HR needs. 
Now, over the next few months, the TriNet Zenefits brand will undergo some exciting changes to make our union even more official, including our name, logo, and an updated website. 
Here’s what’s changing: 
You’ll now know us by one name: TriNet. 
Our product offering, formerly TriNet Zenefits, will become 
TriNet HR Platform.
 
The following new branding will roll out the week of December 18th: 
Our platform on-page branding
Our Login and Contact Us pages
Integrations landing pages accessible via the product/platform
Paycheck stubs and W-2 files
Mobile apps (iOS, Android and iPad TimeKeeper) - displayed as TriNet HR Platform in the app store
Service Items and Invoices
TriNet branded emails
Help Center, ClubZen, Training Center
z‌e‌n‌e‌f‌i‌t‌s‌.‌c‌o‌m‌ will merge with t‌r‌i‌n‌e‌t‌.‌c‌o‌m‌. (Helpful hint: Find the platform login on t‌r‌i‌n‌e‌t‌.‌c‌o‌m‌ in the top right corner of the navigation.)
Here’s what’s NOT changing:
Your account
Current package pricing or services

subject: RE: LCW Review Fieldwork Request
body:
Hi Steven,
Late March works for us.
Looking forward to getting the information request.
 
 
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW
Website
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
View our upcoming events
 | 
Sign-up for our newsletter
 
 
From:
 Steven Lombardo <slombardo@hmscpatax.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, November 28, 2023 2:52 PM
To:
 Antonio Jones <a.jones@lcwmail.com>; Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 LCW Review Fieldwork Request
Importance:
 High
 
LCW team,
 
Hope you all had a great thanksgiving! I wanted to follow up to get our fieldwork scheduled for 2023’s review in 2024.  I know you have an April 30
th
 deadline so I wanted to make sure we scheduled it to provide ample time for us to complete the review.  
 
I am thinking mid to late March unless you’d like it sooner.  
 
Once I hear back, I will send our items request list.  
 
Also, I’d love to catch up and discuss how 2023 is going, what’s new, etc.
 
As always, please reach out with any questions.
 
Thanks,
 
Steve Lombardo, CPA
Hegre, McMahon, & Schimmel, LLC
Partner
www.hmscpatax.com

600 Enterprise Drive
Suite 109
Oak Brook, IL  60523

subject: Toni Jones Has Been Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on November 24th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Toni Jones on 11/24/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Toni from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: As applicable, you'll want to give a final payment via check or direct deposit, and any final severance payments thereafter. This amount may vary depending on your termination agreement. You'll want to confirm and pass any payment with your payroll provider, to ensure that the correct payroll taxes are logged. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Dan Gough Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on November 22nd, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Dan Gough on 11/22/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Dan for termination in payroll on 
11/22/2023
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: As applicable, you'll want to give a final payment via check or direct deposit, and any final severance payments thereafter. This amount may vary depending on your termination agreement. You'll want to confirm and pass any payment with your payroll provider, to ensure that the correct payroll taxes are logged. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Conner Williams Has Been Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on November 9th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Conner Williams on 11/09/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Conner from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: As applicable, you'll want to give a final payment via check or direct deposit, and any final severance payments thereafter. This amount may vary depending on your termination agreement. You'll want to confirm and pass any payment with your payroll provider, to ensure that the correct payroll taxes are logged. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: HubSpot Newsletter: We're acquiring intelligence leader, Clearbit, to expand our data capabilities.
body:
You don't often get email from customermarketing@hubspot.com. 
Learn why this is important
Jennifer, see what all the excitement is about this month with the new acquisition and November insights inside.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  
 
 
What's New
 
Planning season may have just gotten better. Now you can unlock the next level of data-driven storytelling with the updates in this newsletter. Say goodbye to stale and incomplete data as we welcome Clearbit to the HubSpot team. Power up your payments with the launch of Commerce Hub. Discover the tools and resources that will help you as you balance closing strong in Q4 and ramping up for an amazing 2024. And for even more updates, visit 
HubSpot.com/new
.
Reliable, High-Quality Data with Clearbit
 
 
To help our customers grow with industry-leading customer intelligence, HubSpot has reached an agreement to 
acquire Clearbit
, a top B2B data provider. Clearbit enables you to enrich customer records with over 100+ data points and connect with high-fit prospects across 20 million companies and 500 million decision-makers.
 
Real-time, unified data is at the core of the HubSpot customer platform. With Clearbit, we plan to supercharge HubSpot with rich third-party company data at your fingertips. 
 
From tracking website visits to monitoring a company’s news announcements, HubSpot will be able to provide your teams with the most comprehensive context about customers and prospects – at a time when it is critical to identify best-fit customers and purchase intent. 
 
Today, HubSpot’s app integration with Clearbit in our marketplace enables you to increase conversion across the funnel by enriching companies and contacts with third-party data directly in HubSpot. Clearbit has a free product offering that gives users a full picture of their target market, website visitors, and key buyers. For questions or sales inquiries, head to the 
Clearbit website
 or sign up 
here
 to be the first to hear more.
 
Get Started with Clearbit
 
Just Launched
 
 
 
We’ve brought the powerful commerce features you know and love together in the all-new Commerce Hub: an easy-to-use B2B commerce suite with HubSpot’s customer platform.
 
With 
Commerce Hub
, you can streamline your opportunity-to-revenue process to get paid faster using CRM-powered quotes, payment links, and subscriptions. Plus you can automate even more with the Quickbooks integration.
Ready to see Commerce Hub in action? 
Log into your account to learn more
.
Tools & Resources to Make Work Better
 
 
Use AI to Improve Your Human-driven Connections
With the expansion of AI, it’s time to rethink how you market, sell, and support your customers. Insights and strategies in HubSpot’s new “Guide to Connection in the Age of AI” can help your professional services, software, or manufacturing company drive growth by building meaningful customer connections at scale. 
Get the guides now
.
Transform Your Data into Action
Having the right data is the beginning of crafting stellar strategic plans for your organization. Data visualization helps you understand and communicate your company's most significant insights with stakeholders. Get inspired by these examples of data visualization and learn how to apply them to your business when you read 
this blog post
.  
Is Your Business Booming on TikTok?
Customer acquisition is difficult and expensive, and businesses need new ways to find and engage prospects. As the world's growing destination for product and brand discovery, TikTok can help. Thanks to the new TikTok Ads integration for HubSpot, businesses can supercharge lead generation, centralize prospects into a single source of truth, and unlock the full benefits of HubSpot's customer platform to convert communities into customers. 
Check it out now
.
 
Events for the Team 
 
Guess Who's Back...Back Again!
Big News: After selling out of pre-sale tickets in record time, INBOUND 2024 tickets are officially going back 
on sale starting November 27
! Secure your spot at HubSpot's annual event where you’ll learn new tactics to help you do your job better, gain endless personal development opportunities, and master your HubSpot product skills. And we’ve got a 24-hour Cyber Monday discount just for you. 
Unlock your access here.
P.S. - What did you think of this email?
 
 
 
 
 
 
Update language
 |

 |

 | 
Atualize idioma
 |

HubSpot, 2 Canal Park, Cambridge, MA 02141, USA, 888-482-7768

subject: Zenefits now gives you more control over your employee deductions
body:
Hi Jennifer,
We've made it easier to identify and fix any issues with employee deductions. No matter if an employee has had too much - or not enough - deducted on their paystub, you can decide how to correct the discrepancy on your Deductions Dashboard.
Whenever Zenefits sees a discrepancy between what should have been deducted and what was actually deducted, we'll highlight it and recommend an 
adjustment plan
. You can approve the plan to enact the adjustments, or decline the plan and your deductions will remain as they are.
You can review proposed adjustments by clicking on the "Pending Adjustments" button on your Deductions Dashboard. 
Start exploring your employees' deductions now
.
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Now Open: TriNet Zenefits ACA Compliance App
body:
ACA Compliance app now to start preparing for 2023 reporting
  
Hello Jennifer,
The TriNet Zenefits ACA Compliance app is now open! Start reviewing your company’s ACA compliance status for 2023 and access final data at the end of the year to complete filing as early as January 2024. 
The ACA Compliance app gives you in-depth visibility into benefits eligibility and offers of coverage for each employee. 
Access the ACA Compliance app now to start preparing for 2023 reporting.
GET STARTED
*Note: ACA reporting is only required for companies that qualify as an Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE). For information on determining if your company is an ALE, please refer to our 
Help Center article.
Best,
TriNet Zenefits Team

subject: October Newsletter: Free email templates, join your new favorite AI community, and get free help for your projects. Details are in this email.
body:
Jennifer, we're sharing the tools you need to work smarter and grow your business better. Don't miss all the updates in the October newsletter.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  
 
 
What's Happening at HubSpot
 
There's a big office buzz that happens around this time of year. We like to call it the 
Q4
 cheer! As you're gearing up to have the biggest and best quarter yet, we've got your back. Check out what's new for Sales Hub, discover fresh email templates to increase sales, and learn how AI can help you close more deals before Christmas breaks. All this and so much more are featured in this month's HubSpot newsletter––take a peek below. And for even more updates visit 
HubSpot.com/new
 
 
There are 18 powerful features in Sales Hub that your team should be using. Prospect smarter and generate more pipelines with the new prospecting workspace, plus use A/B testing in sequences. Accelerate revenue growth with new intelligent deal management tools like deal inspection and AI forecasting. And finally, tie it all together with new deal journey analytics, lead funnel reports, and more. This update video is a 
must-watch.
Tools & Resources to Make Work Better
 
 
You are coming into your AI-Mastery Era.
Come and be a part of the HubSpot Prompt Practitioners community, designed exclusively for marketing professionals like yourself. Here, you can explore the latest best practices, create outstanding content, and enhance your skills. As a member, you will have access to exciting Ask Me Anything sessions, enlightening lightning talks by exceptional speakers, and daily prompts in Slack to help you sharpen your abilities.
 
Join the community now
 and unleash the power of AI to become a more effective and efficient marketer.
There's an App for That!
How's that for retro? But this new collection of apps contains some of the freshest and most reliable for sales professionals. Create a world-class selling experience
 by integrating these great sales tools with HubSpot. Did you know you have access to 1,500+ ready-to-use integrations to convert leads, accelerate deals, and drive revenue? 
Get started with this curated collection of essential apps for Sales Hub
.
Worth a Watch (Read + Listen)
 
 
🔥 Podcast Alert!
Join us as we explore how we grew HubSpot to a $2B company with more than 180,000 customers globally. Led by your Host Kat Warboys, you’ll hear from HubSpotters who are experts in their field. Whether you're a startup or a scale-up, a marketer or the CEO, you’ll learn from our triumphs (and missteps) that can help you grow better. 
Give it a listen now
.
23 Email Sales Templates You Need  
Truth is, if a prospect doesn’t open your email, the deal is over before it even begins. They won’t read your value proposition to understand how your company can help them grow, nor will they give you a chance to warm them up to the idea of buying your product or service. Regardless of your 
sales strategy
, in today's digital landscape, a sale begins with a great email. 
Start creating yours with these templates
.
🚨New Social Media Marketing course alert...
The Social Media landscape is shifting every day, leaving some of us marketers scratching our heads. Well, some of the incredible professors and the HubSpot Academy team put together a brand new course to help all of us stay on top of our game. 
Take the course now to make your Q4 social strategy pop
. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Update language
 | 
Actualiza el idioma
 | 
Changer la langue
 |
Sprache ändern
 | 
Atualize idioma
 | 
受信言語を更新する
HubSpot, 2 Canal Park, Cambridge, MA 02141, USA, 888-482-7768

subject: Dustin Puehler Has Been Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on October 13th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Dustin Puehler on 10/13/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Dustin from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
COBRA: COBRA Complete is administering COBRA for Dustin Puehler. Zenefits will send Dustin's information to COBRA Complete within 24 hours after the termination date. If you have any questions, please email COBRAComplete@healthaccountservices.com. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: As applicable, you'll want to give a final payment via check or direct deposit, and any final severance payments thereafter. This amount may vary depending on your termination agreement. You'll want to confirm and pass any payment with your payroll provider, to ensure that the correct payroll taxes are logged. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

Hi Jill and Gerald – I hope your summer is going well. I want to introduce you to Toni, LCW’s new controller. Toni started in early July and is such a great asset to the team. Going forward, please direct all correspondence to him as he is fully taking on the role as I have transitioned out.
 
Hi Toni – please meet Jill and Gerald from Eisner Amper. They are the tax preparers and have instrumental in giving sound advice to the nuanced issues arising from the acquisition and ERC. I know you’ll love working with them both.
 
Happy Connecting,
Jennifer
 
------------------------------------------------------
Jennifer Barbieri
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

subject: [Important] Your 3rd Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Zenefits Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
debited from 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by October 09, 2023 for $0.03 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
All In One report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
TriNet Zenefits 
Questions or concerns? Visit 
help.zenefits.com
. 
© Zenefits

From:

Sent:
 Tuesday, September 19, 2023 2:08 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Alsu Schondelmayer <a.schondelmayer@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>; michelle@bookandstreet.com; n.barile@lcwmail.com; Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC - Unauthorized Contact [#1434393]
 
Good Afternoon,
We were recently contacted by Briza Cardenas of LCW.  At this time, they are not listed as an authorized contact for the group, so we were unable to provide any account-specific information to them.  If Briza or anyone else should be added or removed as an authorized contact for the group, please complete the attached Employer Contact Change Form and return it for processing.
Please ensure the form is completed, signed and returned from an existing authorized contact. 
They reached out to us stating:
We recently had a reduction in force and had to lay-off 4 people from our organization. As part of their separation agreement, LCW has agreed to pay 75% of their COBRA costs for the month of October if they choose to sign up for that.
 
Their last day of employment was Friday, September 15
th
. Below are the names of the folks affected:
Ashton Vicente - 
ashton.vic12@gmail.com
Kendall Washington - 
kendall.r.washington@gmail.com
Randy Pringle - 
jingle.pringle@gmail.com
Vince Bongiovanni - 
vbongiovanni612@gmail.com
In order to process this request, it needs to come from a current authorized contact.
Please feel free to reach out with questions.
Kind regards,
 
Mary
COBRA Complete Service Center
COBRACompleteEmployer@healthaccountservices.com
https://cobra-complete.com
877-791-3399

 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Antonio Jones <a.jones@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Schneider, Jill <jill.schneider@eisneramper.com>
Subject:
 RE: Introduction
 
Thank you, Jennifer.
 
Hope everything has been going well for you! 
 
Toni, 
 
Nice to meet you. Looking forward to working with you.
 
Let jump right into it:
 
I attached everything we received to complete the extension for 2022. Is this information finalized and we can move forward with completing the tax return? If not, could you please provide us with the most updated information.
 
Thank you.
 
Gerald Holmes, CPA
 (he/him/his) 
Manager, Private Client Services
 
Eisner Advisory Group LLC
D
: 5168648828 
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Sunday, August 13, 2023 1:36 AM
To:
 Schneider, Jill <
jill.schneider@eisneramper.com
>; Holmes, Gerald <
gerald.holmes@eisneramper.com
>; Antonio Jones <
a.jones@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 [External] Introduction
 
Hi Jill and Gerald – I hope your summer is going well. I want to introduce you to Toni, LCW’s new controller. Toni started in early July and is such a great asset to the team. Going forward, please direct all correspondence to him as he is fully taking on the role as I have transitioned out.
 
Hi Toni – please meet Jill and Gerald from Eisner Amper. They are the tax preparers and have instrumental in giving sound advice to the nuanced issues arising from the acquisition and ERC. I know you’ll love working with them both.
 
Happy Connecting,
Jennifer
 
------------------------------------------------------
Jennifer Barbieri
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC are independently owned firms that practice in an alternative practice structure in accordance with the AICPA Code of Professional Conduct and applicable law, regulations and professional standards. EisnerAmper LLP is a licensed CPA firm that provides attest services, and Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its subsidiary entities provide tax and business consulting services to clients and provide staff and other administrative resources to EisnerAmper LLP. Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its subsidiary entities are not licensed CPA firms.
EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC are member firms of EisnerAmper Global Ltd., a network of legally independent firms, and of Allinial Global, an association of legally independent accounting and consulting firms. EisnerAmper Global Ltd., Allinial Global, and their member firms and correspondent firms (including EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its affiliated entities) are not responsible for, do not accept liability for, and do not owe any duty with respect to the services or advice provided by any other member or correspondent firms.

subject: Fwd: Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC - Unauthorized Contact  [#1434393]
body:
Hi Toni - I hope you’re doing well. I saw this email and thought to pass it along.
Jennifer 
Sent from my iPhone
Begin forwarded message:
From:
 COBRA Complete Account Management <cobracompleteemployer@healthaccountservices.com>
Date:
 September 19, 2023 at 3:08:36 PM EDT
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>, Alsu Schondelmayer <a.schondelmayer@lcwmail.com>, Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>, Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>, Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>, michelle@bookandstreet.com, n.barile@lcwmail.com, Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 
Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC - Unauthorized Contact  [#1434393]
Reply-To:
 cobracompleteemployer@healthaccountservices.com
﻿
Good Afternoon,
We were recently contacted by Briza Cardenas of LCW.  At this time, they are not listed as an authorized contact for the group, so we were unable to provide any account-specific information to them.  If Briza or anyone else should be added or removed as an authorized contact for the group, please complete the attached Employer Contact Change Form and return it for processing.
Please ensure the form is completed, signed and returned from an existing authorized contact. 
They reached out to us stating:
We recently had a reduction in force and had to lay-off 4 people from our organization. As part of their separation agreement, LCW has agreed to pay 75% of their COBRA costs for the month of October if they choose to sign up for that.
 
Their last day of employment was Friday, September 15
th
. Below are the names of the folks affected:
Ashton Vicente - 
ashton.vic12@gmail.com
Kendall Washington - 
kendall.r.washington@gmail.com
Randy Pringle - 
jingle.pringle@gmail.com
Vince Bongiovanni - 
vbongiovanni612@gmail.com
In order to process this request, it needs to come from a current authorized contact.
Please feel free to reach out with questions.
Kind regards,
 
Mary
COBRA Complete Service Center
COBRACompleteEmployer@healthaccountservices.com
https://cobra-complete.com
877-791-3399

subject: Kendall Washington Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on September 15th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Kendall Washington on 09/15/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Kendall from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
COBRA: COBRA Complete is administering COBRA for Kendall Washington. Zenefits will send Kendall's information to COBRA Complete within 24 hours after the termination date. If you have any questions, please email COBRAComplete@healthaccountservices.com. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for IL to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Kendall with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Paid Time Off: Illinois law requires you to pay employees for their unused PTO upon termination unless employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement that states otherwise. If you do owe employees for unused PTO, make sure to add $215.39 to their final paycheck. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: RE: 2021 Amortization
body:
Tony,
 
Hope all is well.  As related to general accepted accounting principles, there was a new pronouncement about five years ago that allowed you to amortize goodwill over 10 years rather than do impairment testing.  Since we are doing a GAAP review for the bank, we are required to adhere to GAAP and made that election.  Prior to that pronouncement goodwill was required to be subject to impairment testing only.
 
You are correct that goodwill is amortized over 15 years for tax purposes.
 
Hope this helps.  Please let me know if you have any other questions.
 
Thanks,
 
Steve Lombardo, CPA
Hegre, McMahon, & Schimmel, LLC
Partner
www.hmscpatax.com
 
Chicago, IL Office:
600 Enterprise Drive
Suite 109
Oak Brook, IL  60523
 
312.345.6203 Office

708.404.7815 Mobile

Subject:

Hi Tony - the Dec amortization entry corrects for the previous entries for the year. That’s why it appears the entry was overstated in December. 
 
I’ll defer to Steve for the answer on the amortization life and rules.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

Can you send some support for reconciling amortization and AJE2? I figure we would use a minimum of 15 years for amortization because that’s what the IRS allows. Our ending number for 2021 seems to align with a 10-year amortization schedule.

subject: August Newsletter: You can watch INBOUND live, join your new favorite AI community, and get free help for your projects. Details are in this email.
body:
Jennifer, we're sharing the tools you need to work smarter and grow your business better. Don't miss all the updates in the August newsletter.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  
 
 
What's Happening at HubSpot
 
Product round-up webinars, roadmaps, new betas, and more are 
here
. Our teams are prepping for the biggest event of the year, hello 
INBOUND.
 Plus we're exploring AI for Marketers, email marketing strategy, and the power of branding guides. All this and so much more in this month's HubSpot newsletter––take a peek below. 
 
 
But you can still get in on the action! 
This year, HubSpot is live-streaming INBOUND 2023, Sept 6-8 on the HubSpot YouTube channel.
 If you’re not able to join us in person this year, you can tune in to watch top moments from our Main Stage sessions for free (including our highly anticipated HubSpot Spotlight!). Our 3-day live stream will include 20+ sessions featuring Reese Witherspoon; Andrew Huberman; Derek Jeter; HubSpot Execs, Yamini Rangan (CEO), Dharmesh Shah (co-founder and CTO); Brian Halligan (co-founder and executive chairperson) and more! For more information on the INBOUND livestream, 
click here
.
Tools & Resources to Make Work Better
 
 
You are coming into your AI-Mastery Era.
Come and be a part of the HubSpot Prompt Practitioners community, designed exclusively for marketing professionals like yourself. Here, you can explore the latest best practices, create outstanding content, and enhance your skills. As a member, you will have access to exciting Ask Me Anything sessions, enlightening lightning talks by exceptional speakers, and daily prompts in Slack to help you sharpen your abilities.
 
Join the community now
 and unleash the power of AI to become a more effective and efficient marketer.
Need an Extra Set of Hands?
Need an extra set of hands to wrap up summer projects or kick off fall projects? Looking to build out a social media calendar or clean up data? A micro-intern could be your solution. For a limited time, you can get an intern at no cost to your organization through the Frederick A. DeLuca Foundation, and our program partner
 
Parker Dewey
.
 
Getting started is easy! Simply post your project 
here
.
Worth a Watch (Read + Listen)
 
Learn how to use cookies with your HubSpot software
Cookies are the secret weapon of bakeries and brands around the world. Learn how powerful your HubSpot CRM can be by leveraging the crumbs your customers leave behind and the information in their contact records. The HubSpot Community blog has a brand new article that will guide you through creating repeat customers through behavior-driven personalization. 
Get started here
.
Got branding on the brain? 
Looking for some creative fuel? Look no further. Discover 21 brand style guides and a complimentary brand-building guide on the HubSpot blog. Find out how brand alignment can make a significant impact on your organization when you read 
this article
.
🚨New email marketing course alert...
New course, who's this?! We heard your request for the most up-to-date email tips, tricks, and strategies. Now you have access to a brand new industry-leading course perfect for marketers, program leaders, and sales teams. Create a dynamic email marketing plan for Q4 and beyond. 
Don't wait, start the course now.
 
P.S. - What did you think of this email?
 
 
 
 
 
 
Update language

Actualiza el idioma
 |

 |

 | 
Atualize idioma
 | 
受信言語を更新する
HubSpot, 2 Canal Park, Cambridge, MA 02141, USA, 888-482-7768

subject: 1 recent hire(s) losing health insurance eligibility
body:
Hi -- wanted to let you know that we're still waiting for the following new employees to either enroll in benefits, or decline coverage. 
Toni Jones, a.jones@lcwmail.com
These employees lose eligibility to join your benefits plans in just a few days on Aug. 22, 2023 at 11:59PM PST, at which point they'll have to wait until the next annual enrollment period. 
Can you ask them to get this done? It should only take them a few minutes. 
If you have any questions feel free to 
reach out to us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Scoro Update: Project Budget Charts
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! Smart budgeting is crucial for project success. So this month, we’re ...
 
 
 
Log in → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
Smart budgeting is crucial for project success. So this month, we’re calling in data visualization to add another dimension to budget planning in Scoro. Our new project charts empower you to plan, track and analyze the budgeted hours even more proactively. 
See what we’ve been up to!
Charts in the project view
To give you further insights into budget burn and progress, we’ve enhanced the project view with two 
charts
. These help you understand how well you’re keeping to your budget 
time-wise
. We’ve placed the charts under the 
Budget insights
 toggle along with the ‘Quoted vs actual’ table.
The 
budget burn chart
 visualizes project progress over time. It’s there to help you detect potential overservicing ahead of time and course correct promptly by replanning or renegotiating the project scope. 
 The 
budget breakdown chart
 helps you track the use of the time budget on a 
role level
 to ensure you stick to the scope. 
 Both charts also include a 
forecast dimension
. 
Read more
 
Ticket tracking in Help Center
Our Help Center is the go-to place whenever you need additional information about Scoro or want to submit a support ticket. Now you can also create yourself an account in our Help Center to conveniently track and manage all your support requests in one place. No more digging through the mailbox as all current and past requests and related communication are stored safely under your account. 
Read more
 about the Help Center account. 
Read more
 
See our blog post for more details!
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

subject: RE: Introduction
body:
Thank you, Jennifer.
 
Hope everything has been going well for you! 
 
Toni, 
 
Nice to meet you. Looking forward to working with you.
 
Let jump right into it:
 
I attached everything we received to complete the extension for 2022. Is this information finalized and we can move forward with completing the tax return? If not, could you please provide us with the most updated information.
 
Thank you.
 
Gerald Holmes, CPA
 (he/him/his) 
Manager, Private Client Services
 
Eisner Advisory Group LLC
D
: 5168648828 
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Sunday, August 13, 2023 1:36 AM
To:
 Schneider, Jill <jill.schneider@eisneramper.com>; Holmes, Gerald <gerald.holmes@eisneramper.com>; Antonio Jones <a.jones@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 [External] Introduction
 
Hi Jill and Gerald – I hope your summer is going well. I want to introduce you to Toni, LCW’s new controller. Toni started in early July and is such a great asset to the team. Going forward, please direct all correspondence to him as he is fully taking on the role as I have transitioned out.
 
Hi Toni – please meet Jill and Gerald from Eisner Amper. They are the tax preparers and have instrumental in giving sound advice to the nuanced issues arising from the acquisition and ERC. I know you’ll love working with them both.
 
Happy Connecting,
Jennifer
 
------------------------------------------------------
Jennifer Barbieri
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC are independently owned firms that practice in an alternative practice structure in accordance with the AICPA Code of Professional Conduct and applicable law, regulations and professional standards. EisnerAmper LLP is a licensed CPA firm that provides attest services, and Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its subsidiary entities provide tax and business consulting services to clients and provide staff and other administrative resources to EisnerAmper LLP. Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its subsidiary entities are not licensed CPA firms.
EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC are member firms of EisnerAmper Global Ltd., a network of legally independent firms, and of Allinial Global, an association of legally independent accounting and consulting firms. EisnerAmper Global Ltd., Allinial Global, and their member firms and correspondent firms (including EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its affiliated entities) are not responsible for, do not accept liability for, and do not owe any duty with respect to the services or advice provided by any other member or correspondent firms.

subject: Re: Intro and Dropbox
body:
Jennifer, 
Hope all is well with you! Great to meet you Toni, albeit virtually. 
I believe you have a due date of April 30th correct with the bank for the review. Therefore, I think it may be best to schedule it late March unless the books will be closed earlier. Beginning of February would be great as well. 
If you can send covenant calcs and anything you are sending to the bank monthly or quarterly, that would be great. Other than that, we will send a request list late in the year for items needed for the review done in 2024.
We do not need access to the Dropbox folders any longer. 
Please let me know if you need anything further. 
Thanks, 
Sent from my iPhone
On Aug 7, 2023, at 5:34 PM, Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿
 
Hi Steve – I hope you’re doing well. I want to introduce you to LCW’s new Controller, Toni, cc’d here. Toni started in early July and he’s been working on getting the 2023 books super tight. What is the schedule for reviewing the financials for 2023? Is there anything you would like to have in the months coming up to the end of the year? Also – Do you still need access to the Dropbox folders that housed the supporting documents? We are looking to close seats we no longer need.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
------------------------------------------------------

LCW

Lake Forest, IL 60045

subject: RE: BD Bonus and commission structure
body:
Hi Alan – there seems to be some confusion here. There are 2 different bonuses:
 
Business Development is paid in my earlier email below in which I forwarded to you from my original email to Rebecca. These should be paid quarterly. The first payment should be made in the next payroll. I have calculated approx. $7K for this payment but seems like 
@Antonio Jones
 may have calculated differently based on his response of $10K.
 
Consulting Bonuses are paid based on the 3% per bonus base (after salaries and cogs deduction) paid annually. I have not calculated the liability this to date mainly because the financials kept shifting and it didn’t make sense to calculate and then recalculate the liability until the financials were closed.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Alan Samsky <asamsky@sutkermoran.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 3, 2023 3:10 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Antonio Jones <a.jones@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Jennifer, this is very helpful, thank you!
 
Do you think we can conservatively budget a bonus expense of $10,000 per quarter which is then paid out the month thereafter; or, is $10,000, not enough?  What if any liability exists at July 31, 2023?  Is it recorded on the balance sheet?  If so, what account?
 
Is the bonus plan below in addition to the Production Bonuses that are stated below in Jennifer’s email? If so, what should be the accrued and unpaid bonuses at July 31
st
?  Is it reflected in the July 31, 2023 Balance Sheet?  If so, What account?  What are the direct salaries that I should deduct from the projected monthly sales?  Did anyone prepare a projection for 2023 and 2024 and quantify what could be the projected 3% bonues?
 
Please advise as I’m trying to come up with some numbers in order to finalize a draft of the projections by tomorrow morning.
 
Thanks,
 
Alan
 
 
 
 
 
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________-
From Chuck -     Jennifer is correct below. The 3% portfolio bonuses are  paid only to consultants and at the end of the year.
 
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 3, 2023 12:12 PM
To:
 Antonio Jones <
a.jones@lcwmail.com
>; Alan Samsky <
asamsky@sutkermoran.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>; Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: LCW - Projections
 
Hi – Bonuses are paid based on the following formula:
 
Invoiced to date
LESS: 
Salaries to date
LESS: 
COGS
 
The amount remaining is the bonus base that is paid out at 3% as a bonus. Historically, this was paid quarterly but there may have been a move to be paid annual. 
@Chuck Adams
and 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 please confirm
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
 
Alan R. Samsky

From:
 Jennifer Barbieri 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 6, 2023 7:31 PM
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi RP - Alisa asked me to send you the BD bonus and commission structure. I’m happy to walk through this with you if you have any questions.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
Sent from my iPhone
 
Sent from my iPhone

subject: RE: BD Bonus and commission structure
body:
Jennifer, this is very helpful, thank you!
 
Do you think we can conservatively budget a bonus expense of $10,000 per quarter which is then paid out the month thereafter; or, is $10,000, not enough?  What if any liability exists at July 31, 2023?  Is it recorded on the balance sheet?  If so, what account?
 
Is the bonus plan below in addition to the Production Bonuses that are stated below in Jennifer’s email? If so, what should be the accrued and unpaid bonuses at July 31
st
?  Is it reflected in the July 31, 2023 Balance Sheet?  If so, What account?  What are the direct salaries that I should deduct from the projected monthly sales?  Did anyone prepare a projection for 2023 and 2024 and quantify what could be the projected 3% bonues?
 
Please advise as I’m trying to come up with some numbers in order to finalize a draft of the projections by tomorrow morning.
 
Thanks,
 
Alan
 
 
 
 
 
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________-
From Chuck -     Jennifer is correct below. The 3% portfolio bonuses are  paid only to consultants and at the end of the year.

 BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi RP - Alisa asked me to send you the BD bonus and commission structure. I’m happy to walk through this with you if you have any questions.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)

$50
$100

$25

$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs

subject: FW: BD Bonus and commission structure
body:
Hi Alan – please see below the BD bonus structure in detail.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 6, 2023 7:31 PM
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi RP - Alisa asked me to send you the BD bonus and commission structure. I’m happy to walk through this with you if you have any questions.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
Sent from my iPhone
 
Sent from my iPhone

Subject:
 LCW - Questions re: Financial Statements
 
 
Hi Toni –
 
A couple of questions regarding the monthly 2023 financials –
 
Due to Seller for the Working Capital True-Up – the December 31, 2022 accountant’s review report indicates the amount owed to the Sellers is $389,720.  The monthly balance sheets through June 30, 2023, see attached indicate that LCW is due a refund of $271,553.81.  Please explain the $661,274 difference. – see attached detail.
 
<image010.png>
  
@Alan Samsky
 add these 2 accounts together
 
Are the deferred revenues customer prepayments? How does this amount fluctuate each month; or, alternatively, shall we assume that the amount will remain flat for balance sheet and cash flow purposes?
Depending on the clients annual budgeting process as well as whether the clients are billed partially in advance. We usually see in Q4 more clients want to send LCW $$ to spend their budget instead of losing it. 
@Antonio Jones
 please review the detail list of deferred revenue and let 
@Alan Samsky
 when these should be recognized
I do not see the Village Bank $250,000 line of credit on the internally prepared financials that you provided, see attached.  The footnotes to the accountant’s review report indicate that the line of credit matured on April 30
th,
 2023 and the amount at that time was outstanding.  
@Alan Samsky
 the was a line of credit but there was nothing outstanding. 
 
Thanks,
 
Alan

Subject:
 LCW - Questions re: Financial Statements
 
 
Hi Toni –
 
A couple of questions regarding the monthly 2023 financials –
 
Due to Seller for the Working Capital True-Up – the December 31, 2022 accountant’s review report indicates the amount owed to the Sellers is $389,720.  The monthly balance sheets through June 30, 2023, see attached indicate that LCW is due a refund of $271,553.81.  Please explain the $661,274 difference. – see attached detail.
 
  
@Alan Samsky
 add these 2 accounts together
 
Are the deferred revenues customer prepayments? How does this amount fluctuate each month; or, alternatively, shall we assume that the amount will remain flat for balance sheet and cash flow purposes?
Depending on the clients annual budgeting process as well as whether the clients are billed partially in advance. We usually see in Q4 more clients want to send LCW $$ to spend their budget instead of losing it. 
@Antonio Jones
 please review the detail list of deferred revenue and let 
@Alan Samsky
 when these should be recognized
I do not see the Village Bank $250,000 line of credit on the internally prepared financials that you provided, see attached.  The footnotes to the accountant’s review report indicate that the line of credit matured on April 30
th,
 2023 and the amount at that time was outstanding.  
@Alan Samsky
 the was a line of credit but there was nothing outstanding. 
 
Thanks,
 
Alan
 
Alan R. Samsky

a.jones@lcwmail.com

c.adams@lcwmail.com
>; Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 LCW - Questions re: Financial Statements
 
 
Hi Toni –
 
A couple of questions regarding the monthly 2023 financials –
 
Due to Seller for the Working Capital True-Up – the December 31, 2022 accountant’s review report indicates the amount owed to the Sellers is $389,720.  The monthly balance sheets through June 30, 2023, see attached indicate that LCW is due a refund of $271,553.81.  Please explain the $661,274 difference.
 
  
@Alan Samsky
 add these 2 accounts together
 
Are the deferred revenues customer prepayments? How does this amount fluctuate each month; or, alternatively, shall we assume that the amount will remain flat for balance sheet and cash flow purposes?
Depending on the clients annual budgeting process as well as whether the clients are billed partially in advance. We usually see in Q4 more clients want to send LCW $$ to spend their budget instead of losing it. 
@Antonio Jones
 please review the detail list of deferred revenue and let 
@Alan Samsky
 when these should be recognized
I do not see the Village Bank $250,000 line of credit on the internally prepared financials that you provided, see attached.  The footnotes to the accountant’s review report indicate that the line of credit matured on April 30
th,
 2023 and the amount at that time was outstanding.  
@Alan Samsky
 the was a line of credit but there was nothing outstanding. 
 
Thanks,
 
Alan
 
Alan R. Samsky
 
Mobile: 847-804-8743 
www.sutkermoran.com
 
  
asamsky@sutkermoran.com

 Monday, July 31, 2023 4:08 PM
To:
 Antonio Jones <a.jones@lcwmail.com>; Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Financial Reports for Thursday's Board Meeting
 
Hi Toni,
 
I’m working on the deck for the board meeting we’re having on Thursday. I’ve cc’d Jennifer because she has experience with what Alisa looks for when pulling these reports, I’ve also attached last board meeting’s deck and a few reports Jennifer has pulled in the past.
Can you send me the following reports for Q1 & for Q2: 
2023 Revenue by Client
2023 Revenue by Product
P&L for Q1 & Q2
How we are currently doing 
 
@Jennifer Barbieri
 are there any other reports he should be pulling for the board? 
 
If you could get me these reports by midday tomorrow that would be great. I’m emailing Chuck and Alisa the deck by the end of the day tomorrow. 
 
Thanks!
Briza Cardenas

subject: Maria Mercado Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on July 31st, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Maria Mercado on 07/31/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Maria from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for NJ to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Maria with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: RE: Bonus Payout  - BD Team
body:
Hey, Alan – I don’t disagree and I think the recent restructuring creates the perfect oportunity to make the adjustment. That said, I’m not a fan of changing the rules in the middle of the game. In this instance we pay out this past quarter’s commissions as the expectation was set with the folks involved. Then we can adjust for the subsequent periods.
 
We certainly need to be cognizant of what actions we are incentivizing and rewarding. For background, I believe as we ramped up formalizing the department, Alisa’s goal was to first incentivize outreach activity and to reward the BizDev department for the actions that they can control. They do not control if the consultant actually closes the deal they marshalled forward.
 
I am very much open to developing a new commission structure that takes those variables into account.
 
Chuck
 
 
Chuck Adams 
(He/Him)
Co-CEO and Managing Principal
LCW

Hi Toni – please see my responses to your points:
 
1 – I agree 100%. In Hubspot when you click on a deal, there 
should
 be a Quote saved in the portal. The Quote is the proposal and you can open the file to see when the date was sent. Please work with Pedro and Rebecca to get this field in Hubspot and populated so you do not have to dig through the data every quarter. There are a lot of missing Quotes in Hubspot. Please also work with Pedro and Rebecca to have a full system of accounting for the proposals sent.
 
 
2. I understand and appreciate your prospective here. The reasoning behind this bonus was to get the BD team to act quickly in getting proposals answered and out the door. This historically was an issue where proposals would take longer than necessary to respond to.
 
3. The proposal bonus is only paid in the quarter the proposal is sent out and not the stage it sits in Hubspot. So as long as the proposal was sent in Q2, the bonus should be paid and whether it stays  or moves up the pipeline, is irrelevant. 
 
4 and 5 – 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 and 
@Chuck Adams
 Please weigh in.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
 
From:

a.jones@lcwmail.com
>

 Tuesday, July 25, 2023 5:06 PM

Cc:

>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>; Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout - BD Team
 
Hi Jennifer – thanks for including me. The calculation makes sense. I have some questions around the process.  My file is attached. The lines without a controller note I still need to review.
Verification of proposals sent and signed SOW’s – as proof of proposals sent, I would expect to see a proposal file sent out on the day listed in the spreadsheet in HubSpot ONLY. Outlook has a function that allows you . For example, Berd LLC lists a proposal sent on 4/7/2023 but I can’t find evidence in HubSpot. this is critical for accounting. Reviewing each bonus line to be paid and proof that we should pay it out.
It would be prudent to only pay out bonuses to BD if a proposal is sent and a SOW is signed. Paying out bonuses for proposals sent and jobs not won sends the wrong signal to associates. It incentivizes channel stuffing for bonuses. Sending out proposals that aren’t likely to be won.
We should not pay bonuses for these stages: negotiation, passed to consultant, proposal in progress, and closed lost. These all represent steps in the sales process and do not indicate that we will receive any money to pay for said bonus paid out. It’ll also cause multiple payments for the same proposal if the proposal extends over more than one quarter. Accounting would also have to compare previous bonus payments to the current period to see if we’re double paying.
If we’re in agreement to pay for proposal sent and jobs did not award it would help if we lowered the commission for those, since we aren’t getting any money and the associate is already on salary. They don’t carry the same weight as jobs won.
Clear definition of proposal needed. Does this include a quote, catalog, and or recommendation PowerPoint?
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW

Hi Melissa – thank you for sending this over. There are a few questions I have here for the team –
 
The Ad Council proposal date was in 2022, the SOW issue date was in March, and the signed SOW date was 6/8. Should this be eligible for the commission since the proposal and SOW issue date was pre-BD Bonus Structure which started in Q2? It doesn’t qualify for the proposal bonus.  
 
If this commission structure remains, this will need to be clarified and put in writing for Pedro. We were told SOW signature (not for counting towards a proposal creation, but for the percentage of the sale). An SOW is just a proposal until signed, and Hannah is responsible for this sale. We sent the attached, and then it was transitioned to Tamara, who received the signed SOW in June. 
Ulteig is closed won. I don’t see this quote in Compas. 
@Melissa Neu
, can you confirm? 
There was confusion with the consultant about whether the attached signed proposal is the same as a SOW. I’ve confirmed with Andrea and discussed with Chuck that she will still need to create an SOW; it doesn’t look like she has done so yet. However, per the attached, the client has committed and signed. 
Should Hannah be paid for the proposals sent after her departure date? (UL LLC, Bright Horizons, nVent, Hopechicago) If not, then the number of proposals for her is 33 (also excluding The Ad Council), which is one short of qualifying for the bonus of 34 total proposals sent for the QTR to qualify. 
Hannah worked on Bright Horizons and HopeChicago.  Hannah helped build the HopeChicago proposal, but I presented it to the client after she left. Also, the date isn’t accurate for UL, LLC.in HubSpot. The deal was created well after the original proposal was sent on 5/9. I’ll get HubSpot fixed, and I’m attaching the proposal for your records.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Hi Jennifer – thanks for including me. The calculation makes sense. I have some questions around the process.  My file is attached. The lines without a controller note I still need to review.
Verification of proposals sent and signed SOW’s – as proof of proposals sent, I would expect to see a proposal file sent out on the day listed in the spreadsheet in HubSpot ONLY. Outlook has a function that allows you . For example, Berd LLC lists a proposal sent on 4/7/2023 but I can’t find evidence in HubSpot. this is critical for accounting. Reviewing each bonus line to be paid and proof that we should pay it out.
It would be prudent to only pay out bonuses to BD if a proposal is sent and a SOW is signed. Paying out bonuses for proposals sent and jobs not won sends the wrong signal to associates. It incentivizes channel stuffing for bonuses. Sending out proposals that aren’t likely to be won.
We should not pay bonuses for these stages: negotiation, passed to consultant, proposal in progress, and closed lost. These all represent steps in the sales process and do not indicate that we will receive any money to pay for said bonus paid out. It’ll also cause multiple payments for the same proposal if the proposal extends over more than one quarter. Accounting would also have to compare previous bonus payments to the current period to see if we’re double paying.
If we’re in agreement to pay for proposal sent and jobs did not award it would help if we lowered the commission for those, since we aren’t getting any money and the associate is already on salary. They don’t carry the same weight as jobs won.
Clear definition of proposal needed. Does this include a quote, catalog, and or recommendation PowerPoint?
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller

Hi Jennifer – thanks for including me. The calculation makes sense. I have some questions around the process.  My file is attached. The lines without a controller note I still need to review.
Verification of proposals sent and signed SOW’s – as proof of proposals sent, I would expect to see a proposal file sent out on the day listed in the spreadsheet in HubSpot ONLY. Outlook has a function that allows you . For example, Berd LLC lists a proposal sent on 4/7/2023 but I can’t find evidence in HubSpot. this is critical for accounting. Reviewing each bonus line to be paid and proof that we should pay it out.
It would be prudent to only pay out bonuses to BD if a proposal is sent and a SOW is signed. Paying out bonuses for proposals sent and jobs not won sends the wrong signal to associates. It incentivizes channel stuffing for bonuses. Sending out proposals that aren’t likely to be won.
We should not pay bonuses for these stages: negotiation, passed to consultant, proposal in progress, and closed lost. These all represent steps in the sales process and do not indicate that we will receive any money to pay for said bonus paid out. It’ll also cause multiple payments for the same proposal if the proposal extends over more than one quarter. Accounting would also have to compare previous bonus payments to the current period to see if we’re double paying.
If we’re in agreement to pay for proposal sent and jobs did not award it would help if we lowered the commission for those, since we aren’t getting any money and the associate is already on salary. They don’t carry the same weight as jobs won.
Clear definition of proposal needed. Does this include a quote, catalog, and or recommendation PowerPoint?

Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

subject: RE: Bonus Payout  - BD Team
body:
Hi Toni – please see my responses to your points:
 
1 – I agree 100%. In Hubspot when you click on a deal, there 
should
 be a Quote saved in the portal. The Quote is the proposal and you can open the file to see when the date was sent. Please work with Pedro and Rebecca to get this field in Hubspot and populated so you do not have to dig through the data every quarter. There are a lot of missing Quotes in Hubspot. Please also work with Pedro and Rebecca to have a full system of accounting for the proposals sent.
 
 
2. I understand and appreciate your prospective here. The reasoning behind this bonus was to get the BD team to act quickly in getting proposals answered and out the door. This historically was an issue where proposals would take longer than necessary to respond to.
 
3. The proposal bonus is only paid in the quarter the proposal is sent out and not the stage it sits in Hubspot. So as long as the proposal was sent in Q2, the bonus should be paid and whether it stays  or moves up the pipeline, is irrelevant. 
 
4 and 5 – 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 and 
@Chuck Adams
 Please weigh in.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
 
From:
 Antonio Jones <a.jones@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, July 25, 2023 5:06 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Alan Samsky <asamsky@sutkermoran.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout - BD Team
 
Hi Jennifer – thanks for including me. The calculation makes sense. I have some questions around the process.  My file is attached. The lines without a controller note I still need to review.
Verification of proposals sent and signed SOW’s – as proof of proposals sent, I would expect to see a proposal file sent out on the day listed in the spreadsheet in HubSpot ONLY. Outlook has a function that allows you . For example, Berd LLC lists a proposal sent on 4/7/2023 but I can’t find evidence in HubSpot. this is critical for accounting. Reviewing each bonus line to be paid and proof that we should pay it out.
It would be prudent to only pay out bonuses to BD if a proposal is sent and a SOW is signed. Paying out bonuses for proposals sent and jobs not won sends the wrong signal to associates. It incentivizes channel stuffing for bonuses. Sending out proposals that aren’t likely to be won.
We should not pay bonuses for these stages: negotiation, passed to consultant, proposal in progress, and closed lost. These all represent steps in the sales process and do not indicate that we will receive any money to pay for said bonus paid out. It’ll also cause multiple payments for the same proposal if the proposal extends over more than one quarter. Accounting would also have to compare previous bonus payments to the current period to see if we’re double paying.
If we’re in agreement to pay for proposal sent and jobs did not award it would help if we lowered the commission for those, since we aren’t getting any money and the associate is already on salary. They don’t carry the same weight as jobs won.
Clear definition of proposal needed. Does this include a quote, catalog, and or recommendation PowerPoint?
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW

Ulteig is closed won. I don’t see this quote in Compas.

However, per the attached, the client has committed and signed. 
Should Hannah be paid for the proposals sent after her departure date? (UL LLC, Bright Horizons, nVent, Hopechicago) If not, then the number of proposals for her is 33 (also excluding The Ad Council), which is one short of qualifying for the bonus of 34 total proposals sent for the QTR to qualify. 
Hannah worked on Bright Horizons and HopeChicago.  Hannah helped build the HopeChicago proposal, but I presented it to the client after she left. Also, the date isn’t accurate for UL, LLC.in HubSpot. Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
