Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Hi Melissa – thank you for sending this over. There are a few questions I have here for the team –
 
The Ad Council proposal date was in 2022, the SOW issue date was in March, and the signed SOW date was 6/8. Should this be eligible for the commission since the proposal and SOW issue date was pre-BD Bonus Structure which started in Q2? It doesn’t qualify for the proposal bonus.  
 
If this commission structure remains, this will need to be clarified and put in writing for Pedro. We were told SOW signature (not for counting towards a proposal creation, but for the percentage of the sale). An SOW is just a proposal until signed, and Hannah is responsible for this sale. We sent the attached, and then it was transitioned to Tamara, who received the signed SOW in June. 
Ulteig is closed won. I don’t see this quote in Compas. 
@Melissa Neu
, can you confirm? 
There was confusion with the consultant about whether the attached signed proposal is the same as a SOW. I’ve confirmed with Andrea and discussed with Chuck that she will still need to create an SOW; it doesn’t look like she has done so yet. However, per the attached, the client has committed and signed. 
Should Hannah be paid for the proposals sent after her departure date? (UL LLC, Bright Horizons, nVent, Hopechicago) If not, then the number of proposals for her is 33 (also excluding The Ad Council), which is one short of qualifying for the bonus of 34 total proposals sent for the QTR to qualify. 
Hannah worked on Bright Horizons and HopeChicago.  Hannah helped build the HopeChicago proposal, but I presented it to the client after she left. Also, the date isn’t accurate for UL, LLC.in HubSpot. The deal was created well after the original proposal was sent on 5/9. I’ll get HubSpot fixed, and I’m attaching the proposal for your records.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

subject: Melissa Horne Neu Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on July 28th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Melissa Horne Neu on 07/28/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Melissa for termination in payroll on 
07/28/2023
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for SC to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Melissa with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Paid Time Off: South Carolina law may require you to pay employees for their unused PTO upon termination, but you should check with your lawyer or accountant. If you do owe employees for unused PTO, make sure to add $1,038.46 to their final paycheck. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

body:

subject: RE: LCW - Information for Financial Projections
body:
Hi Alan – See below. June is the last month we closed. You can add me to the meeting on Friday, if possible. I’ll send you a meeting invite for next week for us to chat.
Reconcile bank accounts.
Reconcile AR & AP, add action notes for old items.
Tie out income from Scoro and QuickBooks, add action items for differences. 
Reconcile credit cards.
Reconcile deferred revenue and make journal entry if necessary.
Book payroll journal entries
Book interest expense journal entries
Reconcile balance sheet accounts.
Month to month comparison of income statement and balance sheet. Confirm normal flow of activity and note and major changes and causes.
Prepare and review cash flow analysis.
 
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW

asamsky@sutkermoran.com
> wrote:
﻿ 
Hi Jennifer –
 
We would like to get a jump on creating the financial projections, using our firm’s format.  Can you provide me with the following information in Excel –
 
Detailed Income Statement by Month Report – from the beginning of the previous fiscal year to the last month closed.  Ideal support would be run as a single report in one tab.
Detailed Balance Sheet by Month Report – from the month preceding the first month of the previous fiscal year to the last month closed.  Ideal support would be a report included within one tab.
Payroll Details by Employee – report with all client personnel including 1.) Employee ID, 2.) First Name, 3.) Last Name, 4.) Position, 5.) Department/GL Code, 6.) Salary/Hourly Rate
AR Aging – for the past three months closed.
AP Aging – for the past three months closed.
6.  Borrowing Base Certificates (BBC’s) from the most recent quarter if BBCs are applicable.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
 
Looking forward to meeting you this week, both for an initial interview and hopefully on Friday to review LCW’s projections.
 
Regards,
 
Alan
 
Alan R. Samsky
 
Mobile: 847-804-8743 
www.sutkermoran.com
 
   
asamsky@sutkermoran.com

Detailed Income Statement by Month Report – from the beginning of the previous fiscal year to the last month closed.  Ideal support would be run as a single report in one tab.
Detailed Balance Sheet by Month Report – from the month preceding the first month of the previous fiscal year to the last month closed.  Ideal support would be a report included within one tab.

Alan

To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi Jen, I just had a chance to review this. 
 
Questions:
I was under the impression that Pedro was the only member of the BD team engaged in the bonus/commission structure below, but it’s great to learn that it appears to be everyone in BD – correct? 
Correct
What is considered a ‘proposal’ in the language below? (i.e., is a short email with product descriptions and pricing considered a proposal? How about a verbal proposal? Does it have to be to a brand  new client or can proposals include expanded business with new clients?) 
Can be any presentation deck sent out as a formal proposal is my understanding and can be to any client status.
What does ‘proposal team’ mean, under item #2, sub-item #1? 
The whole BD team
Confirming that item in yellow below refers to Melissa, and once she leaves to me since I’ll be LCW’s head of Biz Dev? 
Correct
Thanks! RP
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Director of Content & Research
LCW
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 6, 2023 7:31 PM
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi RP - Alisa asked me to send you the BD bonus and commission structure. I’m happy to walk through this with you if you have any questions.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; 
BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
Sent from my iPhone
 
Sent from my iPhone

subject: Your last chance to register for tomorrow's role-based pricing webinar!
body:
We're kicking off the role-based pricing webinar tomorrow. Register today to discover how to use role prices from quote to cash in Scoro.
 
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
It's your last chance to register for tomorrow's role-based pricing webinar, where our product expert, Lauma, will:
Walk you through the 
quote-to-cash flow with role prices
Share the key 
benefits of using role-based pricing
Discuss 
how to transition to role-based pricing
 in Scoro.
If you define the selling rate of different team members based on such criteria as seniority or skill level, don't miss the webinar! 
 
Best wishes,
Team Scoro

Sell, Track & Bill Your Services with Role-based Prices
July 19, 2023 15:00 BST / 10:00 ET / 17:00 EEST

body:
Hi Rebecca – please see below for the answers:
 
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 17, 2023 12:56 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi Jen, I just had a chance to review this. 
 
Questions:
I was under the impression that Pedro was the only member of the BD team engaged in the bonus/commission structure below, but it’s great to learn that it appears to be everyone in BD – correct? 
Correct
What is considered a ‘proposal’ in the language below? (i.e., is a short email with product descriptions and pricing considered a proposal? How about a verbal proposal? Does it have to be to a brand  new client or can proposals include expanded business with new clients?) 
Can be any presentation deck sent out as a formal proposal is my understanding and can be to any client status.
What does ‘proposal team’ mean, under item #2, sub-item #1? 
The whole BD team
Confirming that item in yellow below refers to Melissa, and once she leaves to me since I’ll be LCW’s head of Biz Dev? 
Correct
Thanks! RP
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Director of Content & Research
LCW

j.barbieri@lcwmail.com

r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi RP - Alisa asked me to send you the BD bonus and commission structure. I’m happy to walk through this with you if you have any questions.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; 
BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs

subject: RE: BD Bonus and commission structure
body:
Hi Jen, I just had a chance to review this. 
 
Questions:
I was under the impression that Pedro was the only member of the BD team engaged in the bonus/commission structure below, but it’s great to learn that it appears to be everyone in BD – correct?
What is considered a ‘proposal’ in the language below? (i.e., is a short email with product descriptions and pricing considered a proposal? How about a verbal proposal? Does it have to be to a brand  new client or can proposals include expanded business with new clients?)
What does ‘proposal team’ mean, under item #2, sub-item #1?
Confirming that item in yellow below refers to Melissa, and once she leaves to me since I’ll be LCW’s head of Biz Dev?
Thanks! RP
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Director of Content & Research
LCW
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 6, 2023 7:31 PM
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi RP - Alisa asked me to send you the BD bonus and commission structure. I’m happy to walk through this with you if you have any questions.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50

subject: LCW - Information for Financial Projections
body:
Hi Jennifer –
 
We would like to get a jump on creating the financial projections, using our firm’s format.  Can you provide me with the following information in Excel –
 
Detailed Income Statement by Month Report – from the beginning of the previous fiscal year to the last month closed.  Ideal support would be run as a single report in one tab.
Detailed Balance Sheet by Month Report – from the month preceding the first month of the previous fiscal year to the last month closed.  Ideal support would be a report included within one tab.
Payroll Details by Employee – report with all client personnel including 1.) Employee ID, 2.) First Name, 3.) Last Name, 4.) Position, 5.) Department/GL Code, 6.) Salary/Hourly Rate
AR Aging – for the past three months closed.
AP Aging – for the past three months closed.
6.  Borrowing Base Certificates (BBC’s) from the most recent quarter if BBCs are applicable.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
 
Looking forward to meeting you this week, both for an initial interview and hopefully on Friday to review LCW’s projections.
 
Regards,
 
Alan
 
Alan R. Samsky
 
Mobile: 847-804-8743 
www.sutkermoran.com
 
  
asamsky@sutkermoran.com

Subject:
 BD Bonus and commission structure 
 
Hi RP - Alisa asked me to send you the BD bonus and commission structure. I’m happy to walk through this with you if you have any questions.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created

Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Should Hannah be paid for the proposals sent after her departure date? (UL LLC, Bright Horizons, nVent, Hopechicago) If not, then the number of proposals for her is 33 (also excluding The Ad Council), which is one short of qualifying for the bonus of 34 total proposals sent for the QTR to qualify.

Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

subject: Declined: Monthly Chit Chat Series
[Important] Your 2nd Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Zenefits Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
credited to 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by July 11, 2023 for $0.04 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
All In One report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
Zenefits 
Questions or concerns? Visit 
help.zenefits.com
. 
© Zenefits

Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Melissa – thank you for sending this over. There are a few questions I have here for the team –
 
The Ad Council proposal date was in 2022, the SOW issue date was in March, and the signed SOW date was 6/8. Should this be eligible for the commission since the proposal and SOW issue date was pre-BD Bonus Structure which started in Q2? It doesn’t qualify for the proposal bonus.  
 
If this commission structure remains, this will need to be clarified and put in writing for Pedro. We were told SOW signature (not for counting towards a proposal creation, but for the percentage of the sale). An SOW is just a proposal until signed, and Hannah is responsible for this sale. We sent the attached, and then it was transitioned to Tamara, who received the signed SOW in June. 
Ulteig is closed won. I don’t see this quote in Compas. 
@Melissa Neu
, can you confirm? 
There was confusion with the consultant about whether the attached signed proposal is the same as a SOW. I’ve confirmed with Andrea and discussed with Chuck that she will still need to create an SOW; it doesn’t look like she has done so yet. However, per the attached, the client has committed and signed. 
Should Hannah be paid for the proposals sent after her departure date? (UL LLC, Bright Horizons, nVent, Hopechicago) If not, then the number of proposals for her is 33 (also excluding The Ad Council), which is one short of qualifying for the bonus of 34 total proposals sent for the QTR to qualify. 
Hannah worked on Bright Horizons and HopeChicago.  Hannah helped build the HopeChicago proposal, but I presented it to the client after she left. Also, the date isn’t accurate for UL, LLC.in HubSpot. The deal was created well after the original proposal was sent on 5/9. I’ll get HubSpot fixed, and I’m attaching the proposal for your records.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
C. Melissa Neu
Business Development Manager
+1 (773) 389-5168

﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Business Development Manager

Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

Since this is our June month end close period through 7/15 and a short week, we will need to identify a time that works on our end for the balance of the month-end close.

In the meantime, access to the accounting email will be critical to success.  I can walk him through the categorization and filing of the inbox for 30 minutes on Wednesday afternoon at 2:30pm if you’d like to book that now.
 
Thank you, Briza. Enjoy the holiday!
 
 
Michelle Murcia

Subject: 
Antonio Jones Accounting onboarding sessions
Good afternoon,
 
As you are all aware our new controller, Toni Jones starts this Wednesday, July 5
th
. I’ll be doing his general onboarding sessions the first day and a half but I do not have any role specific sessions scheduled after that. 
@Michelle Murcia
 or 
@Pamela Coulter
 do you have some sort of accounting manual you can share with Toni? I spoke to Randy today and he said you all have been documenting the different processes throughout these past months. Do you have time to lead a few specific accounting onboarding sessions Friday or early next week? 
 
What else besides QuickBooks, DropBox and Compass will he need to have? 
 
Kendall is leading an intro to Dropbox and intro to Compass session but it will only be general, not a deep dive into those systems. 
Below are a list of topics Randy and Jennifer had for David’s onboarding back in Nov. 
Travel Expenses
QB Accounts & Invoicing
Invoice Submission
Payables
QB & Bank Feeds
Payroll
Month End Tasks & Reporting
Month End Reporting Project

subject: Join our next live webinar: Sell, Track & Bill with Role-based Prices
body:
Explore how to use role-based pricing for the entire project lifecycle in Scoro during our next live webinar!
 
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
You can now 
use role-based pricing for the entire project lifecycle in Scoro
! If you define the selling rate of different team members based on their experience, seniority, skill level, or other such criteria, 
join us for our next live webinar
! 
 
During the session, our product expert, Lauma, will:
Share the key 
benefits of using role-based pricing
Walk through the 
quote-to-cash flow with role prices
Give 
tips on transitioning to a role-based pricing
 method in Scoro
Answer your questions in the 
live Q&A section
.
We look forward to seeing you at the webinar! 
 
Best wishes,
Team Scoro
Webinar: Sell, Track & Bill Your Services with Role-based Prices
July 19, 2023 15:00 BST / 10:00 ET / 17:00 EEST
Book my spot
 
 
P.S. Can’t join us live?
 Register anyway, and we’ll send you a recording.

Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
C. Melissa Neu
Business Development Manager

body:
Great – Thank you, Melissa. I sorted the data by proposal sent date and see 4 that have been sent after 6/16 which was Hannah’s last day. Removing these deals, the total is now at 33. I’ll wait for the final report on Friday to see if there are any changes. 
 
Thanks again,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Melissa Neu <m.neu@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, June 28, 2023 11:23 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>; Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
 
C. Melissa Neu
Business Development Manager
+1 (773) 389-5168

On Jun 16, 2023, at 3:34 PM, Melissa Neu <
m.neu@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
C. Melissa Neu
Business Development Manager
+1 (773) 389-5168

If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23

34 Proposals

Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

subject: RE: Bonus Payout  -BD Team
body:
Hi Melissa – I’m reviewing this now and have some questions and comments. Let’s discuss the following:
 
According to Hubspot, I see 2 more accounts that Deb is handling (Women Lift Health and Upwardly Global) to make a total of 4. If we exclude all of Deb’s accounts with the exception of Pfizer per your note, the total number of accounts are now 32 which is less than the 34 minimum to qualify for the bonus
I added in a column for Date Proposal Sent. There are some accounts which do not have a proposal attachment in Hubspot and I don’t know when the proposal was actually sent. Please fill in the missing information so we can evaluate these accounts
The bonus specifically states proposals sent. I don’t think we should be including the proposal in progress stage. There are 3 here on the list 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 and 
@Chuck Adams
 please weigh in here
Commissions are based on executed SOWs so the only account eligible to be paid out commissions on is Insight. SOWs signature pending should not 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 and 
@Chuck Adams
 please weigh in here
 
Happy to discuss further and answer any questions you may have.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

m.neu@lcwmail.com

﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

subject: RE: Revised Q1 financials
body:

Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Karalis, Nicholas <nkaralis@wintrust.com>

Subject:
 Revised Q1 financials
 
Hi Jennifer, 
 
The reviewed financial statements are showing future goodwill amortization of $1,428M or $357M quarterly. 
 
Q1 2023 financials show depreciation and amortization of $238M. Does that figure need to be higher? 
 
I don’t think this will impact EBITDA, but just want to be sure we are working off the right numbers. 
 
Please let us know if we’re thinking about it correctly and if there should be revised financial statements. 
 
Thanks,

subject: Revised Q1 financials
body:
Hi Jennifer, 
 
The reviewed financial statements are showing future goodwill amortization of $1,428M or $357M quarterly. 
 
Q1 2023 financials show depreciation and amortization of $238M. Does that figure need to be higher? 
 
I don’t think this will impact EBITDA, but just want to be sure we are working off the right numbers. 
 
Please let us know if we’re thinking about it correctly and if there should be revised financial statements. 
 
Thanks, 
 
Nick Karalis

subject: Toni Jones Zenefits Onboarding Complete
body:
Hi Jennifer, 
Toni Jones just finished onboarding in Zenefits! All their personal, bank and tax information will be synced to Zenefits Payroll 2 business days before their hire date of 07/05/2023 We're cc'ing your accountant so they have this information, in case they handle everything payroll. 
In the documents section of their 
profile
, you'll find their hire documents (e.g., offer letter, agreements) and tax documents (e.g., W-4, or W-9), as applicable.
Here's what you'll need to do to make sure Toni is all set:
 
Within 3 days of their first day, you should 
complete the employer's section of Form I-9 in Zenefits
. To comply with USCIS regulations, you'll need to view physical copies of the individual's work-verification documents; here's a 
list of acceptable documents
.
If Toni hadn't finished onboarding in time for their first payroll date, you may need to run an off-cycle payroll.
If you have any questions, feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Scoro Update: Introducing Reports Library and Shareable Gantt Chart
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! This month we’re all about better insights – our brand new Reports Li...
 
 
 
Log in → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
This month we’re all about better insights – our brand new Reports Library makes it easier than ever to delve deep into various aspects of your business while a tiny new button in the Gantt chart will forever change the way you share project insights with your clients. 
See what we’ve been up to!
Shareable Gantt chart
Scoro’s Gantt chart is a powerful visual tool that helps you plan out your project and maintain a real-time overview of its scope, timeline, current state and progress. Now you can easily share these insights with your clients as well by showing them the Gantt chart.
 We’ve added the long-awaited 
Share chart
 button to the Gantt chart view. It creates 
a snapshot of the current state of the chart
 and generates a unique link which you can share with people outside your organization. This makes it easier to confirm timelines, align expectations and keep all interested parties up to date and on the same page. You can 
update the snapshot
 manually at any point to ensure it reflects the latest changes and developments. 
Read more
 
Reports Library
Powerful reporting capabilities are one of the pillars of Scoro, helping you analyze various types of data so you wouldn’t have to run your business on a hunch. To save you time and give you even quicker access to valuable insights, we’ve now launched a 
Reports Library
. It includes shortcuts to almost 50 useful reports that help you measure and analyze the key aspects of your business – 
productivity, utilization, revenue, cost, profitability
 and 
sales
. Head on over to the Reports module to browse the library. You can easily customize these ready-made reports further with any additional filters or data columns you need. 
Read more
 
Triggers and actions: dynamic exclusion
Last month we launched our new and improved 
Triggers and actions
 feature to support more complex automations. As a result of the update, you can now also assign dynamic roles, such as creator, responsible user or assignee, as notification recipients. This month we’re adding another dynamic group into the mix – the 
All users except me
 option makes it easier and faster to set up rules to notify you whenever anyone but you modifies some task, event, quote or any other relevant item. 
Read more
 
That's not all! 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

body:
Hi Jennifer,
 
Here’s a report for your review.  Do you need additional information? If so, I’m happy to add more detail and context.  FYI – the highlighted rows are work that Deb is working on and to the best of my knowledge our team hasn’t produced proposals or supported those efforts.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Saturday, June 17, 2023 7:35 PM
To:
 Melissa Neu <m.neu@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Melissa - thank you for sharing. Please provide the list of proposals sent by client that match the matrix sent below. 
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
Sent from my iPhone
On Jun 16, 2023, at 3:34 PM, Melissa Neu <
m.neu@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
C. Melissa Neu
Business Development Manager
+1 (773) 389-5168

subject: Scoro version update planned
body:
Hi Jennifer, Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com will be updated to a new version on 06/22/2023 at 22:00 America/New_York. You don’t need to take any...
 
 
 
Log in → 
Hi Jennifer,
Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 will be updated to a new version on 06/22/2023 at 22:00 America/New_York.
You don’t need to take any action regarding this update. As a cloud platform, we at Scoro do that for you! But we ask you not to schedule any important activities in Scoro for that time.
Here's the full list of new features and improvements.
Have a nice day!
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

Subject: 
QBO usage limits
HI Alisa – I am in the process of entering in the journal entries from the financial review and I am not able to post some of the entries due to a usage limit to QBO. Seems like we have >250 account categories (many of which come from the granular break down of the revenue accounts). Looks like in order to add a few more accounts, LCW needs to upgrade the QBO subscription. Please do this and let me know when it’s upgraded. I can then resume posting the entries.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

subject: COBRA Complete COBRA Employer Portal Registration - Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC - [#1260225]
body:
Good Morning,
Welcome to COBRA Complete. The below process will allow you access to the COBRA Complete COBRA Employer Portal. The Portal provides you with secure, 24-hour access to review and manage your consumers’ COBRA accounts.
Attached is the COBRA Employer Portal Guide and Reporting Guide for your reference when navigating the site.
To access your account for the first time, please follow the below link:
            
https://cobra-complete.com
 
Click New User Registration and enter the registration code provided below:
Registration Code: 3hbPyNrK
Enter your EIN, which is your company’s tax ID number.
Accept the New User License Agreement.
Create a unique user name and password. 
You will receive a validation email from 
no-reply@myhealthpayment.com
 please follow the validation instructions. Once validated you have access to the COBRA Complete COBRA Employer Portal.
 
Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions.
Thank you,
Acerina A
COBRA Complete Service Center
COBRACompleteEmployer@healthaccountservices.com
https://cobra-complete.com
877-791-3399

subject: Re: [DKIM Failure]  Diligent credit
body:
Have we locked QB at 12/31/22?
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 20, 2023 3:43:08 PM
To:
 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>; Rosie Herren <rosie@bookandstreet.com>; Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>; Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: [DKIM Failure] Diligent credit
 
 
Adding Alisa to this thread - 
No changes are to be made for 2022. The books are closed as they have been reviewed by an accounting firm and the report has been issued to the bank. Any changes please make to Q2 as we are now closing Q1.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 20, 2023 4:32 PM
To:
 Rosie Herren <rosie@bookandstreet.com>; Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>; Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: [DKIM Failure] Diligent credit
 
Sharing this with Jennifer and Randy. 
 
Jennifer, how would you suggest we proceed?  Want to be sure the impact to prior period financial statements is minimal.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW 
Email: 
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
Mobile: +1.614.546.8422

From: 
Rosie Herren <
rosie@bookandstreet.com
>
Date: 
Tuesday, June 20, 2023 at 4:25 PM
To: 
Michelle Murcia <
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
>, Pamela Coulter <
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
>
Subject: 
Re: [DKIM Failure] Diligent credit
Credit memo was offset against an invoice: #1
7240330
 (11/21/22) and #
17240330 rev 
(4/1/23)
 
Duplicate pmt should have been posted as unapplied pmt on customers acct in 2022. Instead a credit memo was created in 2022 which hit revenue with deposit posted to deferred revenue. 
So overall AR balance was correct but deferred revenue and revenue was not. I corrected AR with 1/1/23 JE by debiting Deferred revenue and crediting A/R. 
However, this also required me to delete credit memo from Nov22 on 1/1/23 but couldn’t since we couldn’t change 2022 or Q1. To get things correct YTD I still need to cancel impact of credit memo but on 4/1/23.
 
To cancel impact of Nov22 credit memo,  I created invoice 
17240330 rev
 
dated 4/1/23 and applied Nov22 vendor credit 17240330 against this new invoice. AR aging now just shows credit of $12885 for Diligent from JE which represents credit on customer’s account from duplicate payment. Nothing in deferred revenue, cash is correct and sales net zero between the two years. 
 
If you would prefer I can reverse the JE dated 1/1/2 on 4/1/23 but if so then deferred revenue and sales will still need corrected with another JE. Typically speaking, duplicate payments are not handled with credit memos but usually come though on deposit transactions. We can’t alter the 11/1/22 deposit transaction however so a JE is the best we can do or else I have to create a fictitious deposit which I don’t want to do since it involves cash. I have T accounts on this to prove my logic but unable to scan to send to you right now. 
 
Rosie
 
 
From: 
Rosie Herren <
rosie@bookandstreet.com
>
Date: 
Tuesday, June 20, 2023 at 2:48 PM
To: 
Michelle Murcia <
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
>, Pamela Coulter <
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
>
Subject: 
Re: [DKIM Failure] Diligent credit
We can chat when I get back from lunch on this. I couldn't change prior year and I couldn't change Q1.

Subject: 
Re: [DKIM Failure] Diligent credit
Credit memo was offset against an invoice: #1
7240330
 (11/21/22) and #
17240330 rev 
(4/1/23)
 
Duplicate pmt should have been posted as unapplied pmt on customers acct in 2022. Instead a credit memo was created in 2022 which hit revenue with deposit posted to deferred revenue. 
So overall AR balance was correct but deferred revenue and revenue was not. I corrected AR with 1/1/23 JE by debiting Deferred revenue and crediting A/R. 
However, this also required me to delete credit memo from Nov22 on 1/1/23 but couldn’t since we couldn’t change 2022 or Q1. To get things correct YTD I still need to cancel impact of credit memo but on 4/1/23.
 
To cancel impact of Nov22 credit memo,  I created invoice 
17240330 rev
 
dated 4/1/23 and applied Nov22 vendor credit 17240330 against this new invoice. AR aging now just shows credit of $12885 for Diligent from JE which represents credit on customer’s account from duplicate payment. Nothing in deferred revenue, cash is correct and sales net zero between the two years. 
 
If you would prefer I can reverse the JE dated 1/1/2 on 4/1/23 but if so then deferred revenue and sales will still need corrected with another JE. Typically speaking, duplicate payments are not handled with credit memos but usually come though on deposit transactions. We can’t alter the 11/1/22 deposit transaction however so a JE is the best we can do or else I have to create a fictitious deposit which I don’t want to do since it involves cash. I have T accounts on this to prove my logic but unable to scan to send to you right now. 
 
Rosie
